summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to the court chambers, with copies to defense attorneys, submitting revised proposed redactions to motions in limine in the case US v. Maxwell. It lists specific exhibits from both government and defense motions that the parties jointly propose to seal.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of the email submitting proposed redactions to the court on behalf of the government.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding proposed redactions to defense motions in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding proposed redactions to defense motions in the US v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger

events.title: Submission of Revised Redaction Proposals
events.description: The government, with defense joining in part, submits revised proposed redactions for exhibits attached to motions in limine in US v. Maxwell to the court.

locations.context: Address of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, from which the correspondence is sent.
Federal judicial district where the case US v. Maxwell is being prosecuted.

keyFacts: The document is procedural correspondence from November 2021 regarding the sealing of exhibits in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial (US v. Maxwell).
The government and defense are jointly proposing to seal specific exhibits from multiple motions in limine, indicating sensitive material is contained within them.
The defense joins the government's request to seal exhibits for Defense Motions 4, 7, and 13, showing agreement on the sensitivity of those particular materials.
The email attachment includes zip files named 'Government Motions.zip' and 'Defense_Motions.zip', which contain the motions with the proposed redactions.
